page.title: 13ST. JOHN'S, MUXTON,TELFORD
page.content: The original parish of Lilleshall included Donnington Wood. In 1894 a 'tin church' was built to serve the needs of old people and children who lived away from the parish church.It was built for the Duke of Sutherland and cost Â£100.The church is dedicated to St.John the Evangelist.It seated 60 people originally but this was reduced to 45 when the pews were replaced a few years ago. The church is licenced for weddings, funerals and baptisms. The first recorded baptism was in 1966 and baptisms now take place there regularly.There is no record of it having been used for either weddings or funerals.The old tin church is now felt to be inadequate, both in amenities and appearance, for the population of almost 3000 people who live in this area of Telford New Town.
